name: Incline Push-Ups
how_to_perform:
1. Start in a position with your hands shoulder-width apart on an inclined surface or bench, and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.

2. Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine, ensuring that your hips do not sag or pike upwards throughout the movement.

3. Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows until your upper arms are almost parallel with the incline.

4. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels, ensuring that your core stays engaged and your back remains flat.

5. Push yourself back up to the starting position by extending your arms fully and straightening your body.

6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, keeping your core tight and your movements controlled throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Incline push-ups are a variation of traditional push-ups that target the chest muscles while also engaging other upper body muscles.
